description.narrative: Australia and USAID supported community-based emerging infectious disease risk reduction in the Mekong. PREVENT (2012-2015) applied a behavioural change approach to disease prevention. It contributed to risk reduction capacities to control disease transmission from animals, before becoming threats to humans. PREVENT targeted communities at high risk of infection from emerging diseases in wildlife. LAMP (2016-2019) was designed to strengthen Emergency Preparedness for Avian Influenza (AI) through Live Animal Marketing and Production (LAMP). LAMP supported target countries’ to prevent and control zoonotic influenza and other zoonotic diseases at national and regional levels. The activity contributed to strengthened multi-sectoral coordination for effective management and control of AI; regional epidemiology capacities and networks; and evidence-based risk management in livestock production and market chains. The value of this investment is $5.9 million over 8 years, starting 2011-12.
